metadata.Title: CVE-2022-35737 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SQLite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-bounds overflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a C API.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.7
libsqlite3-0 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.7
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.7
sqlite3 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.7
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the wrong commit was previously identified, but didn't match the vulnerability PoC.

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-1ubuntu0.7').
